text: Duncan Montgomery Gray, Jr. (September 21, 1926 â€“ July 15, 2016) was an American bishop and activist. He was the 7th Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Mississippi (a middle judicatory of the Episcopal Church, USA). He was a priest in the southern United States. Gray was best known for his work as a civil rights activist, and his story was included in the University of Southern Mississippi's Civil Rights Digital Archive.Civil Rights in Mississippi Digital Archive, and transcript of Gray's interview. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American civil rights activists Category:Episcopalian bishops Category:People from Jackson, Mississippi
